708070f-a.text:
Eat 42nd Street (across the center from left to right margins ), east from Third Avenue ("E1" thereon) to Second Avenue (right margin), showing prominently the newly erected Bartholomew Bldg. at No. 205 East 42nd Street. Under construction are, to the left a loft building and to the right the Beaux Arts Apartments. Note the Queensborough Bridge beyond the latter. In the foreground is P.S. No. 27 with low buildings to the east. Upon
the latter sites stands the present News Building.
About 1928.
Nwing Galloway

708072f-a.text:
Third Avenue, west side, north from 43rd St., seen from Bartholomew Bldg on NE corner of 3rd Ave. and 42nd St.
The bldg. under construction between 46th and 47th Sts is the new Buchanan apt. house.
In the center of the picture is the Hotel Shelton, Lexington Ave at SE corner of 49th St., and a little to the left may be seen the twin towers of the New York Central power plant at 49th St between Park and Lexington Aves, about to be demolished for the new Waldorf-Astoria. Behind them on the horizon are the new hotels Savoy-Plaza and the Sherry Netherland at 5th Ave. and 59th St.

712796f-c.text:
East 42nd Street, east from and including Third Avenue (foreground, elevated line there upon), showing several prominent buildings of this vicinity, as viewed eastward from the Chanin Bldg. at the S.W. corner of 42nd Street and Lexington Avenue. Opposing each other on the Second to Third Avenue block, are the Bartholomew and the Daily News Bldgs.; the latter being emphasized in View No. 3. Tudor City is at the East River with the Greenpoint Area of Brooklyn across from same.
Oct. 3, 1936
Views 1,2 and 3.
P. L. Sperr
